newsitem.title: EGYPT: Mubarak sends envoy to U.S. to discuss peace.
newsitem.headline: Mubarak sends envoy to U.S. to discuss peace.

text.p: Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak sent an envoy to the United States on Tuesday as part of a widespread diplomatic campaign to revive the stalled Middle East peace process.

Mubarak's political adviser, Osama el-Baz, told reporters at Cairo airport he would meet U.S. Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, U.S. envoy to the Middle East Dennis Ross and National Security Adviser Samuel Berger.
He said his five days of talks in the United States would deal with "means to get out of the dilemma the peace process has reached and U.S. ideas in this regard".
Baz said he was taking ideas with him to help restart the stalled peace negotiations but did not elaborate.
Mubarak met Palestinian President Yasser Arafat in Cairo on Monday to discuss the latest troubles facing the Middle East peace process.
